alert.note: Alert for Hancock (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 09 at 10:41AM CDT until May 12 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri...Illinois...Iowa... Mississippi River at Keokuk LD19 affecting Hancock, Lee and Clark Counties. Mississippi River at Gregory Landing affecting Hancock and Clark Counties. Mississippi River at Keithsburg affecting Louisa, Henderson, Mercer and Des Moines Counties. Mississippi River at New Boston LD17 affecting Louisa and Mercer Counties. Mississippi River at Muscatine affecting Muscatine, Louisa, Mercer and Rock Island Counties. Mississippi River at Ill. City LD16 affecting Muscatine and Rock Island Counties. Mississippi River at Rock Island LD15 affecting Muscatine, Scott and Rock Island Counties. Mississippi River at Le Claire LD14 affecting Scott and Rock Island Counties. Mississippi River at Fulton LD13 affecting Carroll, Clinton and Whiteside Counties. Mississippi River at Bellevue LD12 affecting Jackson, Jo Daviess, Carroll and Clinton Counties. Mississippi River at Camanche affecting Scott, Clinton, Whiteside and Rock Island Counties. Mississippi River at Burlington affecting Hancock, Henderson, Lee and Des Moines Counties. Mississippi River at Gladstone LD18 affecting Henderson and Des Moines Counties. Mississippi River at Dubuque LD11 affecting Jo Daviess and Dubuque Counties. Mississippi River at Dubuque affecting Jackson, Jo Daviess and Dubuque Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Keokuk LD19. * WHEN...Until early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Water affects low lying buildings in rural areas. Water affects the railroad tracks in Alexandria. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:10 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 16.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. The next statement will be issued this evening.
